For security reasons, you will have to update your %s before piloting it. Go to %s for more information.
You are going to calibrate your drone. This quick operation will make it possible for you to fly your drone outdoors.
Please wait while the drone lands…
You will need to calibrate your drone to fly outdoors.

"You are going to calibrate your drone. This quick operation will make it possible for you to fly your drone outdoors. To carry out calibration, you will need to hold your drone. So please land it now, or calibrate it later."
Please keep your drone in a vertical position for 5 seconds

to start, select a tracking mode:
The drone will follow you and keep you in the frame. Watch your surroundings.
Your drone is not far enough
Your drone is not high enough
"The tracking precision depends on smartphones'performance. Take advantage of the free trial to try it with yours. Check out the list of recommended smartphones <u>here</u>."
Use this new button to launch a tracking mode directly from the piloting interface.
While in auto follow mode you can lock the angle of view so that the drone will always look at you from the same side.
Feature only available on GPS embedded devices
Double tap or draw a rectangle
This in-App purchase unlocks new automatic flying modes:
The drone will follow the target using the smartphone GPS and image recognition
Choose a subject whose colour stands out from the environment
To work properly and safely, the auto follow mode needs both your device and drone GPS signals to be strong enough.

move the control from max to min

Place all buttons and joysticks to the 0 position to avoid undesirable behaviour

"Google Maps need to be installed to see your drone's location."
Hand launch allows you to take off by simply throwing your drone up in the air.
Never launch your drone if the option is not activated and propellers aren’t moving.
With the drone in your hand, press “hand-launch”
When propellers start moving slowly, the drone is ready
Launch your drone vertically in the air

"Parrot places great importance on the data of its customers. Deleting your flight data will prevent the customer service team from providing tailor-made help. Your flight data will be deleted within 15 days."
Your request has been duly noted and will be processed shortly.
"Parrot allows you to share flight data on our servers and only those. If you have not accepted the sharing of flight data, these are only stored on your phone and we do not have access to it."
Your request has been duly noted. You will shortly receive an email enabling you to download all your flight history.

Preload a section of the world map for offline use.

To see a map showing the GPS position of the drone in real time while flying, you will need to preload the base map so that it can be displayed even when the Internet connection is offline. Center the map on the area you intend to use your drone and press the Preload button.

Choose the default sharing setting for your pilotings. If you select \"Public\" all your flights will be visible directly on Parrot Cloud.

"AR.FreeFlight 3 Application
1. Legal Notices
The AR.FreeFlight 3 application (and its later versions) is published by PARROT SA, a company incorporated under French Law with a share capital of EUR 1,934,920.57 whose corporate headquarters are located at 174-178, quai de Jemmapes in Paris (75010) France, registered with the Paris Trade Registry under no. 394 149 496.
2. Terms of use
The AR.FreeFlight 3 application (and its later versions) will allow you to pilot the AR.Drone and AR.Drone 3, take photos, make videos, share content, and participate in the pilot forum through the AR.Drone Academy.
Acceptance of the terms of use Access and use of the AR.FreeFlight 3 application (\"the Application\") implies acceptance of these terms of use. If you do not agree with these present terms of use, we request you not consult, or browse our application, or use our services.
These terms of use can be amended by Parrot at any time. Such amended terms of use shall be effective upon publication on our website or our applications. We encourage you to check them regularly. Furthermore, specific procedures and conditions may apply to content, products, materials, services, or specific information contained in or available on other Parrot or third party sites or applications. These specific conditions may be in addition to these terms of use or supersede them in expressly defined cases.
Parrot reserves the right to make changes or updates to Application content or displays at any time without prior notice. Parrot reserves the right to remove or limit access to the Application for any reason whatsoever, at its sole discretion.
Use policy When you use the Application to pilot the AR.Drone, you agree to comply with the following rules: Read the user guide provided with the AR.Drone carefully. Make sure to keep visual control of the AR.Drone at all times when using it, specifically in order to avoid contact between the device and people, animals, or property. Use of the AR.Drone in certain public locations (example: airports, train stations, etc.) or on public roads may not be authorized. Make sure that using the AR.Drone is authorized in your location. Use the AR.Drone in a manner that respects privacy and personal image rights. When used in proximity to strong magnetic fields, radio waves, or strong radiation, the AR.Drone's camera may not stream video correctly. Sand or dust penetration of the AR.Drone, specifically of the camera, may result in permanent loss of operation. Do not use the AR.Drone in unfavorable meteorological conditions (rain, strong winds, snow) or when visibility conditions are inadequate (at night). Keep the AR.Drone away from high tension lines, trees, buildings, or any other potentially dangerous area. Avoid using the AR.Drone in an environment saturated with Wi-Fi® networks (routers, internet devices). A small number of Wi-Fi networks nearby will improve the use of your AR.Drone. Do not use the Application for illegal or unauthorized purposes. International users agree to comply with all local laws regarding drone piloting and online content publication. You may not publish content which incites hate or violence, is threatening, is of a pornographic nature, contains nudity, or gratuitous violence. You may not use the Application and/or AR.Drone for illicit, illegal, malicious, or discriminatory purposes.
[###]Creating an AR.Drone Academy account You can create an AR.Drone Academy account (the \"Account\") to take advantage of AR.Drone Academy services such as recording information about your flights (data, locations, photos, and videos), sharing photos and videos with a community of users , etc. (the \"Services\"): All information which you provide as part of the creation of this account must be accurate, and you agree to update your registration data in order to keep it accurate and complete. All e-mails concerning your Account shall be sent to the e-mail address associated with your Account. We may, at our discretion, reject an Account creation request. You agree that Parrot may store and use your registration data to manage your Account. You may not create an Account for anyone other than yourself without that person's authorization. You must keep your password as well as your other Account information secret and not communicate it to anyone else, in order to avoid illicit use of your Account. You shall be fully responsible for the confidentiality and security of your Account, and all operations performed on your Account or by it, and you agree to immediately inform Parrot of any violation of the security of your Account. If you communicate your Account information to a third party using your Account in breach of these Conditions or if we deem that your Account has been compromised, your Account and/or access to Services can be suspended or canceled. We shall not be responsible for non-authorized use of your Account.
Respect for privacy Collection and processing of personal data via the Application and Services are conducted in accordance with our privacy policy and data protection laws. We encourage you to consult our privacy policy for more details.
Intellectual property - trademarks - copyrights Your content Parrot does not claim any intellectual property rights to photos, videos, sound, texts, or any other content (the \"Content\") that you post through the Application and/or Services. Such Content shall remain your property. By publishing Content on the Services through the Application, you hereby grant Parrot a non-exclusive, free, worldwide right to use, modify, adapt, delete, add, represent, display, reproduce, distribute, and translate your Content shared on the Services, in whole or in part, in any format, on any media, with the exception of Content which is not publicly shared and will not be distributed outside the Services.
You decide who can access your Content. If you share your Content on social networks as well as online services and applications accessible to others users, any user with whom you share your Content can access it. When you authorize other users to access your Content, you grant them the non-exclusive right to publicly use, reproduce, distribute, display, transmit, and communicate your Content free of charge and publicly.
If you authorize the Application to record the location of your photos and videos, be aware that the decision to share your Content on social networks as well as the online services and applications of Parrot and third parties risks exposing this location information to these online applications and services as well as others. When you download Content by using features to Share with Facebook, YouTube, Twitter, or any other online service, you can use settings to delete location information with respect to the Content you are sharing. We recommend that you become familiar with the policies, conditions, and confidentiality settings of these online services and applications before using them to share your Content.
You shall be responsible for backing up Content that you store on the Application and/or Services. Your data and/or Content may be permanently deleted if the Services are suspended or canceled. We are not required under any circumstances to return your data and/or Content once the Service is suspended or canceled. The deleted data and/or Content may be unrecoverable. Parrot cannot be held liable for any modification, suspension, or disruption of Services, or loss of your Content.
Parrot content The Parrot and Parrot AR.Drone name and logos are registered trademarks of Parrot SA. Parrot products, services, and accessories are protected by intellectual and industrial property rights, including trademarks, copyrights, models, and patents. The copyrights and all intellectual property rights in the content of a Parrot site and Parrot application (including the models, designs, photographs, texts, audio, video, and graphics) are and shall remain the exclusive property of Parrot SA or used under licensing agreements. All other trademarks and logos are and shall remain the property of their respective owners.
[###]Warranties You hereby represent and warrant (i) that you are the lawful owner of all the intellectual property rights of Content published by you on or via the Services and/or have all the necessary authorizations to grant the rights in such article and that the use of the Content does not violate any law; (ii) the display, use, and sharing of your Content on or through the Services does not interfere with copyrights, intellectual property rights, or other property rights or rights of publicity, or privacy rights of third parties.
We may refuse to publish your Content for any reason whatsoever. We may delete your Content from the Services at any time for any reason whatsoever, specifically if: (i) you breach this agreement; (ii) the Content does not comply with the limits set forth in terms of storage and file size; or (iii) we cancel or suspend the Services.
You shall indemnify and hold PARROT harmless against any claims, or objections related to Content, coming from third parties invoking violations of any right whatsoever, and specifically against any action for infringement and/or unfair competition and/or free-riding brought by any third party upon execution or use of your Content, and this throughout the term of the granted assignment. In the event that legal proceedings are brought by a third party against PARROT in connection with your Content, you hereby acknowledge and accept liability for all damaging consequences that could result from such proceedings and shall indemnify PARROT for all losses suffered and/or expenses incurred in connection with such proceeding.
Limitation of liability Despite all of the care Parrot has taken in the development of the Application and Services in terms of accuracy, precision, and completeness of the information provided, neither Parrot nor any of its affiliated companies shall accept liability in the event of inaccurate information. ALL CONTENT IS PROVIDED \"AS-IS\" AND ACCORDING TO AVAILABILITY. PARROT MAKES NO WARRANTY WHATSOEVER, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO ANY WARRANTY THAT ALL THE PRODUCTS AND SERVICES ARE AVAILABLE, MARKETABLE, FIT FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE, CAN BE USED WITHOUT INFRINGING THE RIGHTS OF THIRD PARTIES, NOR ANY OTHER WARRANTY REGARDING THE OPERATION OF THE APPLICATION ITSELF OR ITS CONTENT. THE USER IS HEREBY NOTIFIED THAT ALL INFORMATION HE OR SHE SENDS MAY BE INTERCEPTED BY THIRD PARTIES. PARROT DOES NOT WARRANT THAT THE APPLICATION OR SERVERS PROVIDING ACCESS TO THIS APPLICATION AND ITS SERVICES OR ELECTRONIC COMMUNICATIONS SENT BY PARROT ARE FREE OF VIRUSES OR OTHER DESTRUCTIVE ELEMENTS.
IN NO EVENT SHALL PARROT AND/OR ITS AFFILIATED COMPANIES BE HELD LIABLE FOR ANY INDIRECT OR INCIDENTAL DAMAGES, OR MORAL PREJUDICE RESULTING FROM, ARISING OUT OF, OR IN CONNECTION WITH THE USE OR INABILITY TO USE THE APPLICATION, SERVICES, OR THEIR CONTENT, EVEN IN THE EVENT THAT PARROT WAS INFORMED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGE. ANY ACTION BY THE USER MUST BE BROUGHT WITHIN A PERIOD OF ONE YEAR FROM THE DATE ON WHICH THE CAUSE OF THE DAMAGE APPEARED. These conditions apply subject to any mandatory provision of French law which is applicable.
The Application and Services may contain links to other websites or applications which are not controlled by Parrot SA. These links are provided for ease of navigation and neither Parrot SA nor any of its affiliated companies can be held liable for the content or functionalities of websites accessible through these links under any circumstances. Parrot SA and its affiliated companies hereby disclaim all warranties, express or implied, regarding the accuracy, legality, reliability, or validity of the content and functionalities of these sites. Furthermore, neither Parrot SA nor its affiliated companies recommend these other websites. Consultation of these sites shall be your responsibility.
Contact For any question regarding these conditions of use, please use the e-mail contact form available on our site at the following address: http://www.parrot.com, Support Menu, using the \"Contact us by e-mail\" button.
[###]3. Privacy policy
Scope: Parrot respects the privacy rights of all persons. Our privacy policy is intended to explain how we collect, use, and protect your personal data.
Personal data: refers to all data which could identify an individual, a prospective customer, a customer, or a professional contact in a direct or indirect manner.
Non-personally identifiable data: refers to any data which could not be used to identify an individual and which may be collected automatically during your navigation of websites and applications.
Collection of information: We may collect (i) identifiable personal data such as first, middle and last names, age, gender, mailing addresses, e-mail addresses, telephone numbers, demographic and socio-behavioral data via online questionnaires on our websites and/or through our applications at the time of promotions, subscribing to a newsletter and/or services, creating an account, information requests regarding our products and services, requests for demonstrations and technical assistance; and (ii) non-personal information, such as browser type, language, date, time and duration of use, pages viewed, number of videos or photos viewed, etc. during your navigation on our websites and applications. This data may be retained in an identifiable or aggregated form (in such a manner that individuals cannot be identified). When non-personally identifiable data is associated with personal data, we shall treat it like personal data while it remains linked. You may decline the collection of non-personally identifiable data in the application settings.
Use of information: Parrot may use your personal and non-personally identifiable data:
• To validate your registration on www.parrotpartners.com and www.certified.parrot.com, www.parrotoem.com, www.parrotcorp.com, www.parrot.com and all other sites that Parrot may create, • To validate your registration on mobile applications published by Parrot, • To record your product purchases, • To invite you to participate in games, competitions or drawings, • To have you participate in surveys about our products or services, • To invite you to test our new products, • To send you our newsletters or information on our products and services, • For the development and testing of new products, • To improve customer relations, specifically in terms of after-sales service, • To help us provide information on the use of our products and services, • To improve our products and services and perform statistical analysis.
Parrot shall not use your personal information for commercial purposes, particularly for purposes of file leasing and shall not transfer such information to non-affiliated companies.
Transfer of information: Personal data can be disclosed and used by Parrot Group companies throughout the world, subject to the necessary authorizations having been obtained, if necessary. We will only disclose personal data outside the group to any contractual service providers who process personal data on our behalf. When we do this, we ensure that the appropriate measures for protection and confidentiality were implemented as contractually provided.
Individual rights: Individuals may exercise their right to access, correct, or delete their personal data, or withdraw their consent at any time, by contacting our Marketing Department in writing at webmastersparrot.com or contactsparrotpartners.com depending on the site which you are visiting or even by refusing access to technology such as cookies.
Compliance with the law on protection of personal data: All personal data collected by Parrot on its websites and application is used and processed in accordance with European standards governing personal data protection and in pursuance of all other applicable local laws and regulations, as they may be modified from time to time.
Geolocation: Parrot may collect, use, and share specific location data, including real-time location data from your computer, smartphone, or AR.Drone in order to provide geolocation services concerning Parrot products and services. This location data is collected anonymously in a format that cannot identify you and is used by Parrot to provide and improve Parrot products and services.
Cookies: Cookies are text files able to store information on your computer’s hard drive such as the IP address and operating system which helps us recognize your browser to optimize your navigation. Cookies do not contain any personal data. Browsers can be installed to inform people when a cookie is received. This allows people to choose whether or not to accept cookies.
Links to other websites: The Parrot site may contain links to other websites which are not controlled by Parrot and are not covered by the privacy policy herein. If a person accesses other sites using these links, operators of these sites may collect personal data for their own needs and according to their own privacy policy.
Security: Parrot ensures the security of its information systems in order to protect personal data that it receives or sends and takes the necessary measures to prevent any access or disclosure of this data to non-authorized persons.
Amendments to the privacy policy: Parrot reserves the right to update and revise this policy from time to time in order to take into consideration any change in the law or any other developments. Any change made to our privacy policy will be published on this page which contains the date of the most recent update.
© PARROT SA. All rights reserved. Updated: June 2012"
Flight Plan lets you create automatically piloted flight planes with nothing but your thumbs.
Save spectacular videos and list specific locations as Points of interest.
Your drone will gradually change its course between two phases.
With a chronological view, you can program actions at the right moment.
"Take a seat in the director's chair"
Easily set incredible flight plans for your Parrot Disco.
Tracking performance depends on your smartphone (find a list of recommended devices <u>here</u>).
Capture your greatest moments with high precision.
Stay at the heart of the action
The framing assistant lets you easily take truly professional aerial shots.

"As a drone owner in USA territory, you must register it with the Federal Aviation Administration's Unmanned Aircraft System (UAS) registry. A federal law effective December 21, 2015 requires unmanned aircraft registration, and you are subject to civil and criminal penalties if you do not register."
Please, tap button bellow to leave FreeFlight and register your drone in your web browser (please note an internet connection is required).

Welcome to the world of Parrot drones!
Follow your drone on the map with geo-fence display!
Flight Plan is now integrated in the piloting interface and lets you rapidly access your flight plans.
Switch from photo mode to video mode in a snap with the new camera widget.
The telemetry information bar is now active. Click on it to directly get to the associated parameters.
Easily locate your drone using real-time geolocation data.
Locate your drone easily by activating its audible alarm.

"Parrot Bluegrass is a versatile drone developed for use in agriculture. With the use of the drone's built-in video camera and the Parrot Sequoia multispectral sensor, farmers are able to optimize their day to day activities."
You’ll find all your media and can automatically create a Best Of reel featuring the greatest moments filmed with your drone.
Customise your films—choose length, music and style. Let your imagination run wild!
Share instantly with your friends on social networks.
It is now possible to launch your drone with a simple hand gesture from anywhere!
"You'll always be the first informed and won't miss out on any Parrot tips, sales or events!"
"Get photos of yourself and your friends with the photo timer. Just hold down the camera icon and say 'cheese'!"
Your drone adapts to any of your uses. Choose Video mode for breathtaking video capture or Sport mode to greatly increase your drone’s performance.
Flight modes (Parrot Bebop Drone, Parrot Bebop 2)

Cameraman is your framing assistant. It holds the subject to be filmed within the frame. All you need to do is choose your target and framing and navigate your drone – the camera will do the rest. Follow Me – GPS & Visual Tracking is accessible from the Cameraman interface.

For more dynamic video framing, you can now decenter the subject in Cameraman and Follow Me – GPS & Visual Tracking modes. Once the subject has been selected, merely perform a long press on the screen, then choose its location from within the image.
With Touch&Fly, piloting a drone couldn’t be easier! Choose a destination to be tracked on the map and your drone will travel while maintaining its altitude.
Touch and hold the map to create a Point of Interest (POI). Framing will then be done automatically while you navigate your drone.
Magic Dronies lets you take great aerial selfies automatically while you navigate in Follow Me – GPS & Visual Tracking mode. You can also use Magic Dronies on a Point of Interest (POI).
Auto Shots lets you automatically take professional-quality videos in free flight by automating the most complicated camera movements. Check out Reveal, Epic, 360 and Rise.
The radar lets you follow the progression of your drone or find out at any moment if you are correctly oriented in its direction. It also lets you rapidly access map view.
You must specify a country location to set up your wi-fi network.
With WPA2 protection, nobody else will be able to connect your drone
